title.narrative: 3. Advocacy and Media campaign /partnership network_ 3.1 Visibility lobbying and negotiating

description.narrative:
3.1 lobbying and negotiating - September 2020- February 2021 -The legal review , documentation of direct and indirect cases of violations against women with disabilities at home, school, workplace , street and public spaces , as well the key facts on the legislative and protection issues related to disabled women in Jordan were finalized and work is in progress to finalize the KAP S study. Once finalized the study will be disseminated through meetings and sessions with decision makers and influential community members and media outlets.
3Developing partnerships increase outreach and generate support for sustainability and long-term impact. November 2019- October 2022 -A memorandum of understanding was signed with the Jordanian National Commission for Women (JNCW) to exchange of information, knowledge and technical expertise to help meet the objectives of the project and more specifically, exchange information, technical expertise and contacts/networks during the design and implementation of the marriage contracts research and the subsequent advocacy efforts. Furthermore, a concept note about the marriage contracts component of the project was written and passed on by the partner JNCW to a member of the royal family who is considering being a patron of sorts for the advocacy component of the project with religious stakeholders. MoU with JNCW annexed
IRC- Department of Statistics NL Embassy project 09/20 , 167

receiver-org.narrative: King Hussein Foundation;Their mission is to build upon King Hussein’s lifelong commitment to peace, sustainable community development and cross-cultural understanding through national and regional programs that promote education and leadership, economic empowerment and participatory decision-making.
